alert.note: Alert for Clark; Taylor (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 06 at 3:51AM CST until March 06 at 3:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Lingering Impacts Mainly North of I-94 Today... .A bulk of the wintry mix has ended across a majority of the region. A light wintry mix may persist into Monday morning along with gusty winds for areas mainly north of I-94. Additional snow accumulations for these areas would only be 1 to 2 inches by the end of the day. Some travel impacts for this morning`s commute are possible due to the accumulating snow from the overnight. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 6 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Taylor and Clark Counties. * WHEN...Until 3 PM CST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Visit 511wi.gov for road conditions.
